Save tibble as CSV, TSV, or RDA file

Source: R/utils.R
save_df.Rd

save_df() saves a dataframe in the specified format (CSV, TSV, or RDA) in a specified directory. If the directory does not exist, it will be created. The recommended file type is RDA.

Usage

save_df(
  df,
  file_name,
  dir_name,
  date = FALSE,
  file_type = c("csv", "tsv", "rda")
)

Arguments

df

The dataframe to save.

file_name

The name of the file to save.

dir_name

The directory where the file will be saved.

date

If TRUE, a directory with the current date as name will be created in the directory with dir_name.

file_type

The type of file to save the dataframe as. Options are "csv", "tsv", or "rda".

Examples

# Save a metadata dataframe as an RDA file
save_df(example_metadata, "metadata", "my_data", file_type = "rda")

file.exists("my_data/metadata.rda")  # Check if the file exists
#> [1] TRUE
unlink("my_data", recursive = TRUE)  # Clean up the created directory
